intro: Tetranthera attenuata var. laevigata, commonly known as the smooth tetranthera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruits are small, dry, and three-lobed, containing a single seed. This variety is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in shaded, humid environments.
